statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: LIU Brooklyn gets 1st win, beats Maine 83-70
article.headline: LIU Brooklyn gets 1st win, beats Maine 83-70
article.linkText: LIU Brooklyn gets 1st win, beats Maine 83-70
article.story: BANGOR, Maine -- Elvar Fridriksson had 19 points and seven assists to lead LIU Brooklyn to its first win of the season, a convincing 83-70 victory over Maine on Tuesday night. Landon Atterberry scored 16 points, Iverson Fleming added 11 and Gerrell Martin chipped in 10 for LIU Brooklyn (1-6). Maine held a slim 34-30 halftime lead, but Fridriksson nailed a 3 to open the second half, Atterberry hit another 3-pointer and Nura Zanna drove for a layup as the Blackbirds took a 38-36 lead. LIU Brooklyn stretched its advantage to 60-47 at the midway point of the second half. Maine's Marko Pirovic nailed a 3-point jumper with 1:59 remaining to close to 77-66. The Blackbirds made 10 of 17 from long range, part of making 27 of 54 attempts from the floor (50 percent). Shaun Lawton had 16, Garet Beal added 14 and Zarko Valjarevic chipped in 12 for Maine (1-7).
